Title: Promotion Specialist (Chuyên Viên Phát Triển Quà Tặng)
Company: Công Ty Cổ Phần Sữa Vitadairy Việt Nam
Location: HCM Office – Floor 5th, Saigon Trade Center, 37 Ton Duc Thang, Ben Nghe Ward, HCMC, Trụ sở chính tại HCM: Tầng 5, Số 37 Tôn Đức Thắng, P. Bến Nghé, Quận 1, HCM/ VP. Hà Nội: Toà nhà CT1 - The Zen Residence, Khu đô thị C2 - Gamuda Gardens, Phường Trần Phú, Quận Hoàng Mai, Hà Nộ
Job Description:
Chịu trách nhiệm chính trong việc lập kế hoạch, triển khai và tối ưu hóa các chương trình quà tặng và khuyến mãi nhằm thúc đẩy hành vi khách hàng, nâng cao hiệu quả thương hiệu và doanh số, đồng thời đảm bảo vận hành quà tặng hiệu quả trên toàn hệ thống.

1. Lập kế hoạch & đề xuất chương trình (30%)

- Lên kế hoạch và chủ động đề xuất concept chương trình khuyến mãi (CTKM) theo từng mùa vụ, nhóm khách hàng, kênh hoặc chiến lược thương hiệu.

- Sử dụng dữ liệu xu hướng hành vi đổi quà, đối thủ cạnh tranh và nhu cầu khách hàng để xây dựng cơ cấu quà phù hợp mục tiêu thương hiệu & doanh số.

2. Quản trị danh mục & ngân sách quà tặng (40%)

- Lập kế hoạch nhu cầu & phân bổ ngân sách quà tặng theo từng CTKM.

- Tìm kiếm, lựa chọn nhà cung cấp & đặt hàng quà tặng (ưu tiên quà độc đáo, tiện ích, chi phí hợp lý).

- Kiểm soát chi phí quà, nguyên vật liệu đóng gói, vận chuyển và làm đề nghị thanh toán.

- Quản lý tồn kho, vận hành đưa quà lên hệ thống (App, Website...), đảm bảo sẵn hàng & không tồn đọng ngân sách/quà tặng.

3. Phối hợp triển khai & tối ưu hiệu quả (20%)

- Phối hợp thực hiện thủ tục đăng ký Sở công thương liên quan đến CTKM, Quà tặng.

- Phối hợp triển khai với các Stakeholders để đảm bảo CTKM đồng bộ và khả thi.

- Theo dõi hiệu quả chương trình (ROI, tỷ lệ đổi quà, độ phủ, tồn kho...), thu thập phản hồi từ thị trường, khách hàng & các stakeholders.

- Đề xuất cải tiến/tối ưu CTKM cho chu kỳ tiếp theo.

4. Báo cáo (10%)

- Báo cáo và phân tích đổi quà trên toàn hệ thống, đề xuất các giải pháp tối ưu chi phí quà tặng (tuần/ tháng/ quý/ năm).

- Báo cáo chi phí quà tặng và khuyến mãi đã sử dụng theo định kỳ.

- Báo cáo kế hoạch quà tặng và khuyến mãi mới, cần đẩy tồn, hết hàng.

- Báo cáo theo yêu cầu của Cấp trên
Job Requirements:
- Tốt nghiệp đại học về các ngành nghề liên quan đến Kinh tế/ Marketing…

- Ít nhất 3 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí liên quan, có kinh nghiệm về quà tặng Trade, CRM,Trải nghiệm khách hàng, Loyalty là một lợi thế.

- Có kinh nghiệm làm việc với bên mua hàng và cung ứng

- Có khả năng phân tích, nghiên cứu thị trường, lập kế hoạch và theo dõi đúng tiến độ công việc

- Có khả năng thích nghi và làm chủ công việc

- Khả năng sắp xếp công việc và multi-tasks
Keyword: Công Ty Cổ Phần Sữa Vitadairy Việt Nam

Title: Customer Experience Manager - Junior Level
Company: Clo Virtual Fashion
Location: 29a Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Da Kao, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, 29a Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Da Kao, District 1, Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam
Job Description:
Position Introduction

We are looking for a visionary to join our team in Vietnam. We are not small anymore but a global team and the environment will be close to that of a start-up. We wear many hats, brainstorm many ideas, and are filled with a passion for all things Fashion & 3D.

Join the Global CX team as a new CX manager for the Southeast Asia market!

The Global CX chapter is responsible for CLO subscription business and operations targeting individual and student users. CX managers plan, implement, and control the efficient flow and develop services between CLO and all creators worldwide. The Team units are located in Korea, USA, China, India, Germany, Spain, France, and Brazil.

To Apply
- Must submit your resume in English

Responsibilities
→ Daily Operational work to serve CLO individual/ student user community managing inquiries, support, and the website.
→ In-depth analysis of user inquiries, support, and user activities on clo3d.com website and CLO’s social media channels.
→ Analyze service gaps and recommend effective measures to prevent mishandlings and claims.
→ Review and improve service processes across the entire service chain to create positive customer experience thereby enhancing the branding of CLO.
→ Research not only in Vietnam but also in Southeast Asia to expand individual and student users.
→ Work with other teams to execute project workstreams as part of the wider company business.
→ To lead customer experience improvements in user workflow, contents and website operations working with Web Developers.
→ Plan and execute online/offline events mainly targeting potential or/and existing CLO subscription users working with the Marketing Team.
→ Communicate actively and work in tandem with the Global CX chapter to have aligned goals and strategies.
Job Requirements:
→ 2+ years of work experience in business development, operations, marketing, or user research in the tech industry.
→ Agile work ethic; comfortable with trials and errors.
→ Critical thinking and creative strategizing.
→ Open to working with colleagues from different places, time zones, backgrounds, and cultures.
→ Strong project planning and management skills.
→ Native in Vietnamese and strong written and verbal communication skills in English

Plus if you have
→ Knowledge and experience in 2D/3D CAD, B2C SaaS business
→ Academic studies in Statistics, Business Administration, and Information Technology related majors
→ Proficiency in other Southeast Asia languages (e.g. Thai, Malay, Indonesian, Lao, Burmese, Cambodian, and Filipino, etc.)

Title: Admissions Manager
Company: Công ty Cổ phần Giáo dục và Đào tạo Tinh hoa Toàn cầu
Location: Trường Quốc tế Him Lam Bắc Ninh – Khu đô thị Him Lam Green Park, Đại Phúc, Bắc Ninh, Tầng 20, LPB Tower, 17 Tông Đản, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội
Job Description:
The Admissions Manager is a core member of the School’s leadership responsible for planning, executing, and monitoring all aspects of the student admissions process. The postholder provides strategic oversight of enrolment growth, leads the Admissions team, ensures a high standard of customer service, and maintains robust data systems to support school decision-making.
This role plays a critical part in promoting the school to prospective families, ensuring alignment with HIMLAMIS strategic priorities, safeguarding protocols, and Vietnamese educational regulations.

I. Strategic Leadership
• Lead the development and implementation of the school’s Admissions Plan to meet annual enrolment targets across all pathways in both Kindergarten and Inter-Level.
• Analyse market trends and school data to recommend strategies that enhance enquiry conversion, retention, and onboarding success.
• Report regularly to the School Director and Board on enrolment data, conversion pipelines, and projected numbers.
• Forge and maintain strong working relationships with relocation agents, embassies, local businesses, and feeder schools to widen the prospective parent base.
II. Operational Management
• Oversee all stages of the admissions process from initial enquiry to enrolment and onboarding, ensuring each step reflects the school’s values and professional standards.
• Ensure admissions procedures are implemented consistently and align with internal policies and CIS safeguarding standards.
• Coordinate with Academic Leadership, Student & Parent Care/School Office, and Operations to ensure smooth transitions for new and departing students.
• Maintain and improve CRM and MIS platforms, ensuring accuracy and functionality for enrolment reporting and forecasting.
III. Team Leadership and Development
• Supervise and guide the Admissions team to deliver high-quality service to prospective families.
• Set and monitor KPIs for the Admissions team including lead response times, conversion rates, and service satisfaction scores.
• Lead regular training and coaching sessions to develop staff knowledge of HIMLAMIS curricula, school culture, and customer care standards.
• Foster a team culture of responsiveness, attention to detail, and cross-cultural sensitivity.
IV. Relationship Management and Parent Engagement
• Act as the primary contact point for high-priority admissions cases or concerns, representing the school with empathy and professionalism.
• Attend key school events, open days, and fairs to build rapport with current and prospective families.
• Handle sensitive admissions cases such as student withdrawals, delayed onboarding, or special placements with discretion and care.
V. Policy Compliance and Quality Assurance
• Ensure compliance with Vietnamese law (MoET), safeguarding practices, and CIS international standards in all admissions matters.
• Conduct internal reviews of admissions procedures annually and lead continuous improvement initiatives.
• Maintain confidentiality and data privacy across all student records and admissions communications.
VI. Additional Duties
• Other tasks as assigned by the Line Manager or School Director.
Job Requirements:
1. Education
• Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Sales, Marketing, Public Relations, Communications, Education, or related fields
2. Experience
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a senior admissions, sales, or marketing role (preferably in education).
• Experience managing teams.
• Event planning experience is a strong advantage.
• International or bilingual school experience preferred.
3. Skills & Knowledge
• Strong written and spoken English and Vietnamese communication skills; additional language skills (e.g. Korean, Mandarin Chinese) highly desirable.
• Outstanding interpersonal skills and public speaking confidence, especially in presenting to parents in guiding decision-making conversations.
• Strategic thinker with strong planning, branding, and analytical capabilities.
• Experience using CRM tools or student databases is preferred.
• Proven ability to manage deadlines, multitask, and lead a team in a high-expectation environment.
• Flexible, dynamic, and service-oriented mindset with a genuine passion for education.
Keyword: Công ty Cổ phần Giáo dục và Đào tạo Tinh hoa Toàn cầu

Title: Senior Brand Advocacy & Content Specialist
Company: Công Ty Cổ Phần Sữa Việt Nam (Vinamilk)
Location: Vinamilk Tower - No. 10 Tan Trao, Tan Phu Ward, District 7, Số 10, Tân Trào, P. Tân Phú, Q.7, Tp. HCM
Job Description:
Job Overview:
Develop and implement strategic initiatives to enhance brand advocacy and expand brand influence across digital and community platforms. Collaborate cross-functionally to establish standardized frameworks and manage content partnership programs that drive credibility and engagement.
Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with Brand, Strategy, Legal, and Corporate Affairs teams to understand product/category insights and define advocacy-driven communication strategies.
- Plan and execute community-based and influencer-driven brand initiatives through parenting groups, forums, online communities, and macro/micro opinion leaders.
- Develop and maintain the Brand Advocacy Playbook, including communication angles, partner guidelines, publishing schedules, and campaign measurement models.
Lead content partnership efforts:
- Coordinate with media platforms, publishers, and community-based networks to develop collaborative content that promotes positive brand positioning.
- Negotiate, plan, and supervise content partnerships aligned with brand identity and strategic messaging.
- Monitor and analyze performance metrics across key campaigns: reach, engagement, sentiment, brand favorability, and earned media value.
- Oversee execution by agencies and partners to ensure message alignment, delivery quality, and cost-effectiveness.
Job Requirements:
- Bachelor's degree in communications, Marketing, Sociology, or related disciplines.
- Minimum 2–3 years of experience in social content, influencer marketing, or advocacy strategy in FMCG or digital agencies.
- Strong ability to translate consumer and category insights into advocacy strategies and content plans.
- Experience in developing advocacy playbooks is a strong advantage.
- Proven coordination skills across internal and external stakeholders.
- Creative, analytical, and result-oriented with strong project management capabilities
Keyword: Công Ty Cổ Phần Sữa Việt Nam (Vinamilk)

Title: [Hà Nội] Brand Officer/ Consumer Marketing Officer
Company: Diana Unicharm JSC

Title: 3D Design & Implementation Specialist
Company: CLO Virtual Fashion
Location: 29a Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Da Kao, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
As a 3D Design & Implementation Specialist at CLO Virtual Fashion, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of fashion through our true-to-life 3D garment simulation technology. Your role will involve working with global brands to implement 3D workflows by planning customized curricula, training users, supporting client inquiries, and contributing to innovation with software developers.

Hiring Process
[Resume Screening] → [1st interview] → [2nd interview] → [Reference Check] → [Offer]

To Apply
- Must submit resume and portfolio in English
- Must submit the portfolio showcasing your 3D fashion design skills

Responsibilities
• Working with leading brands in fashion, sportswear, and technology
• Assisting clients in becoming proficient users of CLO through tailored training
• Supporting clients with 3D adoption strategy and implementation
• Organizing and facilitating workshops and live demonstrations
• Collaborating with the CLO Design and Implementation Team to bring new projects, events, and ideas to life
• Creating 3D content for user engagement, social media, and various initiatives
• Participating in client projects on and off-site (open to international travel)
• Collaborating with software developers to propose innovative features and applications for development
Job Requirements:
Requirements
• Proven experience as a 3D Fashion Designer, preferably within the fashion industry with a strong understanding of garment construction
• Candidates must know Vietnamese and English
• Creative, curious, driven, and takes initiative
• Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
• Strong communication skills
• Positive and enthusiastic attitude with a desire to invest in long-term
• Willingness to travel (frequently)

Plus if you have
• Professional knowledge of fabric trim
• Proficiency in 3D software such as CLO3D, Marvelous Designer, or similar tools.
